III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation When youth went AWOL from the facility, unknown staff would get
the youth back and do unspecified bad things to them including
rape.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 8/14/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information regarding
this allegation.
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Program Manager were each interviewed
separately face-to-face at the facility on 8/18/2025. Each denied
any awareness of staff engaging in sexual contact with youth at
the facility during the time frame of 2/15/2024-8/19/2024. Each
denied awareness of youth having contact with staff while AWOL
during that time. Each denied awareness or witnessing any youth
returning from AWOL receiving any type of abuse including
physical or sexual. Each denied punishments being given out to
youth upon return from AWOL by staff. Each reported youth would
be on observation for safety purposes upon returning.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
8/18/2025. Therapist denied awareness of youth being sexually
assaulted by staff at any time, when returning from AWOL, or
while AWOL. Therapist reported Youth A expressed concerns
however could not recall at the time of the interview exactly what
those included. Therapist reported those concerns were reported
and addressed.
Youth B and Youth C were each interviewed separately face-to-
face at the facility on 8/18/2025. Each denied awareness of any
youth including themselves having any sexual contact with any
facility staff while AWOL or when returning from AWOL. Each
denied awareness of any staff sexually assaulting any youth at the
facility at any time. Each denied punishments being given by staff
to youth who return from AWOL. Each reported youth would be on
observation when they returned.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face in her current placement.
Youth A reported youth would go AWOL and return to the facility
pregnant from their time being AWOL. Youth A reported the youth
who would return pregnant were pregnant from having sex with
staff while they were AWOL. Youth A denied knowing who the
staff were who would have sex with the youth. Youth A denied any
youth telling her these allegations. Youth A could not remember
which youth were pregnant from staff. Youth A reported Youth C
was one of the youth who went AWOL and had sex with a staff.
2

Documentation Review:
• Staff and Client Interaction Policy states staff should never
present themselves in a manner that can be construed as
sexual or flirtatious. Policy prohibits corporal punishment.
Policy prohibits contact between staff and youth outside of
the facility.
• Ongoing Investigation 2025SIC0000701 regarding Youth A.
The allegation states: Daily, from April 2024 thru August
2024, a supervisor at the facility would follow a youth into
the bathroom, force the youth to undress, and touched the
youth's private parts. The staff member also tried to have
sex with the youth, but the youth refused. The youth had to
be physically violent with the staff or else the abuse would
continue. This investigation is still in progress.
Analysis There are no rule violations established regarding this allegation.
The allegations were consistently denied by staff and youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
